document.title: Oregon Health Education Standards and Benchmarks

5303ECE82B9E4BB19A860FEF526C673B.description: Manage interpersonal conflict in non-violent ways.

AD7E163A95244908A232BB71DFCA11DB.description: Demonstrate the steps of problem solving, anger management and impulse control.

FA1B8E3AAE364BCFBCD3004B87E14335.description: Explain the role of problem solving, anger management and impulse control in preventing violence.

4C5A56C2F62A4A26B4C969602E7E3373.description: Explain how helpful and hurtful messages in media and technology can influence.

519ECFD9406D4949B8CB61191B5056FD.description: Identify that media and technology may contain violent messages and images.

067DDEED686D470F91F62A89670068DC.description: Demonstrate how to respond and report if someone is bullying, harassing or teasing.

2A8A4038BD8B413A936FA0260E51FD8C.description: Identify how to report unsafe situations to trusted adults.

ED19E88857914DBE86441291ED99EA1A.description: Identify why bullying, cyber-bullying, harassment and teasing are detrimental to health and safety.

9CB9E18518004CA79B5361792DC2FBEF.description: Set a goal to engage in positive, helpful behaviors.

C33644A100C8453A9EAEA4A196D3B32A.description: Demonstrate ways to prevent violence and unsafe situations.

comments: Acquire knowledge and skills to prevent different forms of violence and suicide with a focus on communication and pro-social behaviors.

E08A2AB5E639444B96C3D3C6B2D12B23.description: Use the decision making process to identify safe locations and meeting places at home and school the event of an emergency.

7B67EC4B8CDF4AEC93D65DE518D27F9E.description: Demonstrate how provide emergency information to a 911 operator.

FA98A94CF0604446AA6666ECFC5E877D.description: Demonstrate what to do during an earthquake including methods of "duck, cover and roll".

D1066BA029D64FF8A5E187F7B8E5479D.description: Demonstrate how to dial 911 and other emergency numbers and provide appropriate information.

6799EB6DBC454F74937085FE2EE6DC9D.description: Identify what to do during an emergency and/or natural disaster, including floods, earthquakes.

979EFC9E4A79472B8E6A86FBA0479F0D.description: Set goals to prevent during sports and physical activity.

35E81BB31C89437CB9A23F75AE794191.description: Demonstrate the correct use of protective equipment during physical activity.

DD16B193C20649EF94551AB11B089592.description: Explain the importance of safety at play including wearing helmets, pads and other safety equipment.

818FB7BB84274FD484B98C528603E359.description: Use a decision making model to plan a safe route to and from school.

32B0BEF658BB44A98B109E779653A3BD.description: Demonstrate pedestrian and bike safety practices.

5BBFF98497454D319D2F592832BF1085.description: Identify safe behaviors when traveling to and from school and in the community.

64E584D5FD1644BD9BC16B592C22102C.description: Set a goal for safety in and around water.

2AD23B106C8E4CEDB0DC92C712CF080F.description: Identify ways to reduce risk of injuries in and around water.

24E451C1B9004508B85CC1AADD86C68F.description: Encourage family to test fire alarms regularly.

262F078652EE4308999ED858C17CB24F.description: Develop a home fire escape plan and practice it during the day and at night with family.

98018F238D584621A48645BFA64E00FC.description: Identify ways to prevent fires and reduce the risk of injuries in case of fire.

46A4C94FDB924C01AF51C06D9B16C601.description: Identify danger signs and symbols on products.

9DF5A4414F3D4C11B2C96301FFFA98EE.description: Identify labels on home and school products that give information about harmful ingredients.

comments: Acquire knowledge and skills necessary to be safe at home, on the move, at school, and at work and in the community and how to get help in case of injury.

FB8A2A9CB63244DA8BE20C5132A540E9.description: Demonstrate how to respond if someone is bullying or teasing them.

E93A60DA10D24EFE96689CC100272C52.description: Identify parents and other trusted adults they can tell if they are being bullied or teased.

F085287558D04D21B838B534B3E19E2D.description: Explain why bullying and teasing are inappropriate behavior.

6A90E3C54E9C465683080B7DAB591492.description: Identify who to report to at home, school and in the community if you see unsafe objects.

B20C67821C6341F0B642050E9DA77E38.description: Explain why it is important to stay away from potentially unsafe body fluids and objects.

F9EFD4072AAE40208BB04117C7E3742E.description: Practice and use refusal skills if someone is touching you inappropriately.

A9789850C3484F1999E6460D5FD3942A.description: Demonstrate how to clearly say no, how to leave an uncomfortable situation, and how to identify and talk with a trusted adult if someone is touching them in an uncomfortable way.

036165C4D2314EA68DEBA4EBEBB7BECB.description: Identify parents, and other trusted adults they can tell if they are feeling uncomfortable about being touched.

C3C7B915CFD2432CB235815E2E3A3E1A.description: Explain the difference between appropriate touch and inappropriate touch.

C9D9762A584843EBB73C1095BC487B68.description: Identify body parts, proper anatomical names and stages in the basic growth process.

AF8EA1A684304581AE109B949F425CB2.description: Provide examples of how friends, family, media, society and culture influence how males and females think they should act.

A7CA56424CB9455897DB3CE7934F432A.description: Identify the physical similarities and differences between males and females.

comments: Acquire knowledge and skills that emphasize the importance of safe behaviors in maintaining sexual health.

1046A0D965564AFEBF0247B0C4749C1B.description: Set a personal goal to use and wear safety equipment correctly during physical activity.

3A157C2481C84ECB904F33ACA055B2AC.description: Demonstrate the use of safety equipment during physical activity.

93A9C3BA497A4573A413C63703BD5354.description: Identify safety equipment needs and procedures for physical activity.

389E4357250D4A94B45C6A728E3C941A.description: Identify the health related fitness components; strength, flexibility, cardiovascular and endurance.

555D927F2F7541F795B89CD2C7B1B0F6.description: Analyze influences that encourage youth to participate in physical activity.

5D8C8FE72F204C3D9376C41EFF12FBA4.description: Identify places where youth and families can be physically active.

5261CF28FEC94A3296E077F230487F74.description: Give examples of the benefits of physical activity.

comments: Acquire knowledge and skills to understand the role physical activity has in promoting health.

BB5473C4918C4E59846365F7254775AD.description: Promote a safe and welcoming environment for people of all gender expression.

281E44C2CBB14531A02C02D9D92609A5.description: Provide examples of how friends, family, media, society and culture influence ways youth act based on gender.

0CAF0B0E6BBB4AFAA653BB4359E02414.description: Describe differences and similarities in how boys and girls may be expected to act.

397C653669A14D3A80114F219507DD0F.description: Recognize diversity among people, including age, disability national origin, race, color, marital status, and sex, sexual orientation and gender identity.

29EC98577AEE464E97E38F02FEAE33CD.description: Identify and set a goal to help manage stress.

6900477D0FEF44D5AA30A4952DD07AF0.description: Identify personal stressors at home, in school, and community.

0FDC5434FE7542D6B235A681D2FAE86B.description: Describe internal and external influences on emotions.

B412A7AB2F7248DEB5437D165E7673CE.description: Identify characteristic of a healthy self-image.

03E385D050EE4684A7CC29489EA52731.description: Identify qualities that contribute to a healthy self-image.

3F105F417CA9485B96154A102D552BC0.description: Demonstrate positive communication skills that express personal needs, wants and feelings to family and peers.

E2DFCC96B7D54E26B5C0729A1D8EC80F.description: Describe pro-social behaviors within healthy relationships.

07ABE79665214DB59EF4365E77ACEAB7.description: Promotion of Mental, Social and Emotional Health
comments: Acquire knowledge and skills to understand that mental, social and emotional health contributes to building and maintaining interpersonal relationships.

3CA5617712444BACABEEEDFE6B656B66.description: Identify how advertising strategies influence our food choices.

89ABB2182D6C40AEB2F3088B588858F7.description: Recognize the impact advertising has on food choices.

EFE88DEEB5AE4C608CFBD95B48DCE8C5.description: Demonstrate safe preparation and food storage practices.

E08AFEB7AE254A62B29CBF8E4B36012A.description: Recognize how to keep food safe through proper food preparation and storage practices.

E0A2EBC661E04414B6A810EA7FF52DA0.description: Recognize how healthful eating habits can lead to wellness.

516BAC64B02B4752B1AA2A9FF402B2C4.description: Advocate for a variety of foods from all food groups (focus on food groups to encourage: dairy, fruit, vegetables and whole grain).

2B0475D8680C47FB90B75608B095ED56.description: Choose a variety of foods from all food groups at home and school.

AFAABC8B561C470BAEA27F5437FB1F44.description: Recognize the importance of variety and moderation in food selection and consumption.

31A5E478B96842F2B4B6E8961AD0DB63.description: Set a personal goal for healthy eating and track progress.

64FD9A69193740FCB62B402BF6759DDF.description: Explore the food groups in the USDA guidelines and identify and list examples from each.

68F925121DBF47E79CC569B358441BB9.description: Identify the food groups in the current USDA recommended guidelines.

comments: Acquire knowledge and skills to understand and practice healthful nutrition that contributes to growth and energy and helps prevent chronic diseases.

587BBDE7261F4BEDAE24D2139CFD3939.description: Set a goal for creating a healthy environment and reduced exposure to a potentially harmful substance at home and school.

F0246693AB4A4E4D9DAFFF93C3915646.description: Identify ways to reduce exposure to potentially harmful toxic substances including second-hand smoke.

2FB07E3974034551AFAE4E84645758B1.description: Demonstrate ways to protect oneself from ultraviolet radiation (sun) and other harmful substances.

D61E104654F84BE88F11333BE48B01D6.description: Identify ways to reduce exposure to the sun.

151E12F10A4248708A91AD957E5D4E25.description: Encourage family and community members to adopt healthy environmental practices.

C5A5AB41547B41F7A022A5D69AAC6128.description: Access information on how air and water pollution affects health.

7AF74C4AD6CC4281B39F14631228C454.description: Identify sources of air and water pollution.

comments: Acquire knowledge and skills to determine how protecting the environment impacts health for individuals and society.

C8EED7BA72784851AD3B079CD19F2449.description: Share strategies for preventing the spread of communicable disease to others.

D9783DD9103D4D9D8A6DA948C9257215.description: Develop personal goals to prevent the spread of communicable diseases.

00FB50628B4B4449ADBFE002D901B3EB.description: Identify important personal health care practices that prevent the spread of communicable disease (including HIV/AIDS, and Hepatitis B and C).

C943C5BDE5EE43AC9417BE50B2CB5B13.description: Use the decision making model to make healthy decisions for preventing disease.

E71594CEDA2448479B6799ECC244B7F7.description: Demonstrate strategies for effective personal health care.

71FCB493C5DD4DD8B1E751E4E7D1D9C0.description: Explain ways to prevent communicable and non-communicable disease and understand the difference.

comments: Acquire knowledge and skills to understand and practice health habits that can prevent and/or control disease.

EB20261429724217B52614E955153F2C.description: Practice reporting use/misuse of 'over the counter' and prescription drugs to trusted adults.

A1822226E3084B83B328EFD5FE6FA92A.description: Describe school policies about alcohol, tobacco, 'over the counter' and prescription medication use.

A9A04F2806DC428A90F205C69BA87724.description: Identify appropriate person(s) to dispense medication to children.

4EB56529AEB34B47BFCFF2BC7C7D50FE.description: Describe appropriate use of 'over the counter' and prescription drugs.

391460B4F06740B8A5CDC1E6598C5006.description: Demonstrate ways to avoid secondhand smoke.

33BDB4981FCD4D58A3D327E26EDD6AC3.description: Identify that secondhand smoke is harmful to personal health.

62D8846982F240A2AC74BC9F0AB3C39F.description: Demonstrate refusal skills around the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

A5C8B09789B544F1959FD57A1A3CC265.description: Identify that alcohol and tobacco are harmful to one's health.

A94C95E4011141D3873FC54829D02F18.description: Recognize the influences that persuade young people to abstain from alcohol and tobacco use.

750011DCCA7B4B51B2A543F8868F8BB9.description: State reasons why young people choose not to use alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

35028DA9F2C145B799BB364D17570E41.description: Identify tobacco-free signage within the school environment.

0F4140DA589A4CD58710DCF0BE9BF5DE.description: Explain the benefits of a tobacco-free environment.

11238EB6A35F4CACBBEB7134C3EBCABC.description: Alcohol, Tobacco and Other Drug Prevention
comments: Acquire knowledge and skills to understand the physical, social emotional effects of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs and their use.
